bibl.title: Letter from Lydia Cabrera to Philip Showalter Hench, November 3, 1953

div1.p: Cabrera congratulates him on his nomination for the decoration of Carlos Manuel de Cespedes. She has read his description of the rescue at sea of the Greenville.

div1.head: Letter from Lydia Cabrera to Philip Showalter Hench, November 3, 1953
div1.opener:
Dr. P. S. Hentch
Nov 3, 1953 QUINTA SAN JOSE
REDENCION
MARIANAO-CUBA
div1.p:
Mi querido Gran Oficial de la Bene-
merita Orden de Carlos Manuel de Cepedes:
mis congratulaciones...
I suppose you have already the official communica-
tion of your nomination, published in all
the newspapers of Havana. This is the higher
decoration of the State, and I hope you will
be great cross, next year. (And Finlay's ascen-
tion will come soon.) It has been delayed
an account of changes in the Direction of
Finlay Institute, and cubanerias, as you know.
We don't know yet who is going to be the
new Director, the last one was delighted
with the idea of your visit, and very anxious
to meet you.

Now, for our plans.
Mrs Smith, is going haveto celebrate the we nutrition
week on january 22nd to 28- she wants you
to come, at least since the 25 to the 28- she
is going to write you and wants me too
prey you in advance, to make a little
effort and change your trip to this date.
QUINTA SAN JOSE
REDENCION
MARIANAO-CUBA
It doesn't make any difference for the
imposition of the cross; possibly is the
President Batista who will give it to you-
I have been reading all afternoon your
description of the rescue of the Greenville.
You certainly have a litterary talent
besides the Cortisana etc! Now, Julia
is submerged in the waves of the furious
ocean, and afraid to go to Europe!

Let us know soon from you; it will be
a joy to see you and Mary again-
div1.closer:
Mi abajo de Lydia y otro, de Tina- (very “embullada” with
your visit.).
